data: NEURO/NSURG Bowel Protocol (Module)
Medications
If patient has GFR less than 30 mL/min use Bowel Protocol Renal
CONTRAINDICATIONS: Complete bowel obstruction, diarrhea, colostomy, ileostomy, short bowel syndrome
Additional Diet Information
Fruit Lax, 30 mL, PO, BID
Day 1
Select polyethylene glycol 3350 (preferred) OR lactulose
PEG 3350 powder
17 g, PO, qdaily, PRN constipation, drug form: powder
lactulose 10 g/15 mL oral liq
10 g, PO, qdaily, PRN constipation, drug form: oral liq
lactulose 10 g/15 mL oral liq
20 g, PO, qdaily, PRN constipation, drug form: oral liq
Day 2 (continue Day 1 treatment)
Select sennosides (preferred) OR magnesium hydroxide with cascara
sennosides
12 mg, PO, qHS, PRN constipation, drug form: tab
24 mg, PO, qHS, PRN constipation, drug form: tab
Select magnesium hydroxide AND cascara liquid
magnesium hydroxide 1.2 g/15 mL oral liq
2.4 g, PO, qHS, PRN constipation, drug form: oral liq
cascara
15 mL, PO, qHS, PRN constipation, drug form: oral liq
Day 3 (continue Day 1 and Day 2 treatment)
Glycerin supp and fleet enema are contraindicated if patient has subarachnoid hemorrhage with an unsecured aneurysm or an AV malformation
glycerin adult supp
1 suppository, rectal, once, PRN constipation, drug form: supp
Day 4 (continue Day 1, Day 2 and Day 3 treatment)
phosphates (FLEET) 130 mL enema
1 application, rectal, once, PRN constipation, drug form: enema
